articles.title: UK lifts retail ban on crypto ETPs, unlocking access to a £800B market
articles.author: Cryptoslate
articles.summary: The UK Financial Conduct Authority has lifted its three-year ban on retail trading of crypto exchange-traded products (ETPs). The decision reverses a January 2021 restriction that prevented retail investors from accessing ETPs. It unlocks a deep pool of demand that has been sitting on the sidelines since 2021.

articles.title: Breaking: Crypto Market Crashes as Trump Imposes 100% Tariff on China
articles.author: Coin Gape
articles.summary: The crypto market continues to experience a drop after President Donald Trump announced a 100% tariffs on imports from China. The drop is due to a drop in the value of the crypto market. The market is also down because of the increase in the tariffs on Chinese imports.

articles.title: University of Sheffield, UK Opens Applications for MSc Financial Technology Starting September 2026; Details Here
articles.author: Our Web Correspondent
articles.summary: The University of Sheffield is now accepting applications for its MSc in Financial Technology and Innovation programme, scheduled to begin in September 2026. The postgraduate course is open to graduates from all academic backgrounds aiming to pursue careers in finance, accounting and emerging technology-driven roles. To be eligible for admission, applicants must hold a three- or four-year bachelor's degree with a minimum of 60% from a recognised institution. The tuition fee for international students enrolling in 2026 is £35,840 per year.

articles.title: Singapore Delays Adoption of Global Standard on Bank Crypto Exposure
articles.author: Qing Na
articles.summary: The Monetary Authority of Singapore has delayed the implementation of a new global standard on banks' exposure to crypto assets by at least one year. The rules will take effect no earlier than Jan. 1, 2027. The Basel Committee on Banking Supervision established the rules for implementation by January 1 next year.
